title: Copperplate is to be respected
content:
Greeting Comrades!  
I often see blogs about a font face  
people dislike with a zeal.  
However, I never hear anything about  
Copperplate and it's everywhere.  
I once was told by a former Professor  
that it's a respected font even though it's  
overused. Don't get me wrong I like  
Copperplate.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140930154119im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Copperplate_3838.gif)
author: Typedog

comments.content: The lack of a true lowercase limits the usefulness of Copperplate, but for certain applications it has exactly the right balance of strength and grace. Also, it seems to work better than most fonts when set on a curved baseline, as on the perimeter of a circle (think Presidential seal).

@phrostbyte64

It's a respected font no matter how many times it is used.

Guerrizmo+Design  
No man is an island unto himself\_John Donne
